content.webTitle: List of ethical advisers and fund managers

fields.headline: Where to go for ethical advice
fields.bodyText: Opening a green bank account or savings account should be as simple as deciding you agree with the bank of building society's green principles, filling in the form and waiting for your cards in the post. But because of their diversity, deciding on a green investment fund can be a bit more tricky. Standard advice is to consult an independent financial adviser. Unfortunately, traditional financial advisers don't know very much about the green investment sector. Their knowledge may be limited to the straightforward banking products provided by companies such as the Co-operative Bank. This is changing, but to make sure you are getting tailor-made ethical advice which respects your values and beliefs, go to an adviser who specialises in ethical investment. List of ethical financial advisers: The Ethical Investment Cooperative The Ethical Investment Consultancy Ethical Investments Ethical Investors Group Ethical Investment Services Global and Ethical Investment Advice The Ethical Partnership Ethical Financial Ethical Investment Research Centre Lifestyle Financial Services Barchester Green Investment Alan Seward Financial Services Shakeshaft & Co.
